text.text_translated:
A hula hoop is a ring you move around your body.  
The Seven Summits are the highest mountains on each continent.  
Wasfia Nazreen first saw a hula hoop as a young girl.  
She saw it when a foreign child visited her native Bangladesh.  
She did not want to play.  
She stood by and watched the child play with it.  
In her country, people said girls should not play hula hoops.  
They also said girls should not ride bikes.  
Wasfia is one of the few people to climb the Seven Summits.  
She climbed Everest and Kilimanjaro.  
She is the first person to hula-hoop on each mountain top.  
She does it to help women and girls do sport.

best_attempt.text_translated:
A foreign child visited Bangladesh.  
That child played with a hula hoop.  
Wasfia Nazreen saw the hula hoop when she was a young girl.  
Wasfia watched. She did not join.  
In her country, people said girls should not play with hula hoops.  
They also said girls should not ride bikes.  
Now Wasfia is one of the few people in the world to climb the Seven Summits, including Everest and Kilimanjaro.  
She is the first person to hula-hoop on each peak.  
She does it to empower women and girls.  
People in her country say girls must not do sport.
